content:
We're making a movie! Help make it happen here: http://wongfuproductions.com/movie

BEHIND THE SCENES & DIRECTOR'S COMMENTARY
http://wongfuproductions.com/2011/04/strangers-again-new-short-film/

Every relationship goes through stages. Where and how each stage develops is ultimately up to each person. While we always hope for the best, we often can't avoid the inevitable.

Josh and Marissa are at a crossroads and their future is uncertain. Josh guides us through each stage of the relationship as it formed and as he predicts it will end up as.

1st Bball Friend - Peter Yim
2nd Bball Friend - Shane Warren http://www.youtube.com/shanewarren0

2nd Bar Friend - Chester See http://www.youtube.com/Chestersee

SPECIAL THANKS
Ben Zhu - Owner - Nucleus Art Gallery (Alhambra, CA)
Charlie Pecoraro - Manager - Micheli's Restaurant (Universal City, CA)
Vicky - Owner - ParkSeungChol Hair Studio (Garden Grove, CA)
John Kim - Photographer

CLOSING SONG
Love - David Choi

Some WARDROBE PROVIDED by:
http://www.areyouaniceguy.com

*made w/ no crew and no budget. Just friends trying to make something good. =)

Directors' concept:
For those that didn't get it totally, here's the full concept behind the video.
David and Lana are both sitting in this white room. We also show them going on with the rest of their lives (hanging out w/ friends, shopping, meeting new people) but they are still always in this room together. The idea is that, no matter where we go and how we move on in life, we're still always somehow connected to that special someone we were with, in a frozen place and time. In this video, that place is the white room; and here in this place, David explains (sings) to Lana that if he were to see her again, he wouldn't try to talk to her.

Towards the end of the video, we see them switch positions as well (David was on the right, at the end he's on the left). We also show each of them revisiting each other's locations. (Lana went to the bball court, David went to the salon, etc). This could imply that maybe they did try to find each other again, but missed. Now in this suspended white room, he gives up, and she watches him go.

title: Home:Word - Magnetic North & Taiyo Na ft. Sam Kang - Official Music Video
content:
Dedicated to our families.

Like the mother and daughter, we all have those moments where we neglect our parents, too busy living our own life, we often forget that on the other side our parents are working hard and have struggled to give us as good a life as they can.
Like the son, pressures from school can be the biggest struggle for young people. While it's important, sometimes stepping away to find that true peace keeps us going. Whether it's in art and photography, making videos, singing, dancing, or even video games with friends.
Like the father, jobs and financial worries can bring us down. Especially in these tough times, when so much is uncertain, the greatest gift we have is knowing that there is one constant, family.

title: Technology Ruins Romance: The Airport
content:

title: When Five Fell
content:
Can the things we love, love us back just the same? Five household objects express their feelings toward their owner when she begins to neglect them for someone else. "When Five Fell" is a new take on the ideal boy-meets-girl love story. Although the short is told from a unique and unconventional perspective, the emotions described should be familiar to anyone that's fallen in or out of a relationship. "When Five Fell" is a prologue to "At Musing's End" Watch it here: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tgx8wpr6-eY

We delight in the promise of falling for love.
We crumble in the dread of falling from love.
Everyone falls. Everything falls.

title: Two After Noon
content:
How would you spend an unexpected pocket of time with a stranger? Two After Noon revolves around the idea that two people can be thrown together, be attracted to one another, and connect on a meaningful level-- but still not end up together. That may sound like a tragic notion at first, but that's only if you interpret it as an ending. There are no real beginnings and endings; instead, everything is continuous and ongoing. There are so many things in our lives that are indefinite. Finding love and companionship certainly fit into that category.

DIRECTOR'S NOTES: http://wongfuproductions.com/2012/04/two-after-noon-%E2%80%93-new-short/

title: Home is Where the Hans Are - Ep 1
content:
WATCH Episode 2 here: http://youtu.be/mxkQRzX4i28

BEHIND THE SCENES: http://youtu.be/tMc-CCLtGrs
DIRECTOR'S COMMENTARY: http://wongfuproductions.com/2012/02/home-is-where-the-hans-are-directors-commentary/

A new mini-series from Wong Fu Productions in association with FremantleMedia.

Our goal with this series is to show a general audience who might not be used to seeing Asians as a typical TV family, that seeing our faces in these roles should not be strange. We have a place among everyone else and we can all get along and make great content. 
We're excited to be working with FremantleMedia who sees the potential for Asian Americans in the mainstream media. We hope you can share and support this new project. The more views the higher chance this might actually be turned into a TV show! How awesome would that be?! Thanks!

Created in association with AWTV a FremantleMedia company
Subscribe and support! http://youtube.com/atomicwedgietv

title: These Four Walls
content:
Dare to explore a world that is bigger than you know. There are a lot of reasons to not do something or not feel something. Those boundaries and walls are put up by ourselves. Once we're able to step outside of them, we can truly realize the endless possibilities the world has to offer.

title: SHELL
content:
Full Commentary and Behind the Scenes here: http://wongfuproductions.com/2011/08/new-shell-short-film-released/

Our lives are shaped by our experiences. Our experiences are preserved in our memories. But what if we had a chance to remember things that we never actually experienced? "Shell" explores this idea through a quiet conversation. If you could look through a window that softened the edge between reality and fiction, what would you want to see? What would you want to remember?

Official Trailer for 2011 Seoul International Extreme-Short Image and Film Festival www.sesiff.org

Written and Directed by Wesley Chan
Produced with Philip Wang

title: WFW 3 - Natalie wants a CHURRO!
content:
Natalie Tran aka CommunityChannel, was in LA recently and had only one day to hang out. What did she do with that one day? She used it to hang out with us. (silly) haha. This was actually the first time we ever met Natalie, though we've been long time fans of her work, so we really had a great time. During the day she kept saying all she really wanted to do was get a Churro. She also kept saying how cheap things are in America, so we took her to Costco. Two birds with one stone.

SUBSCRIBE to Natalie! She's sucha sweet, nice, funny girl!

content:

title: The Places We Should Have Gone
content:
We're making a movie! Help make it happen here: http://wongfuproductions.com/movie

We often want second chances. Sometimes we don't deserve them. The feeling of regret and wishing for another chance is common when a couple separates. Whoever is at fault usually searches for sympathy as they have realized in hindsight their mistakes.

Shot while on vacation in Taiwan with my family. Featuring Kaohsiung, Kenting, Gongliao, and Taipei. No crew or budget, just running around the city with a couple friends. =)

BEHIND THE SCENES + DIRECTOR COMMENTARY: http://wongfuproductions.com/2011/03/new-short-the-places-we-should-have-gone-phil/

title: Technology Ruins Romance: War Torn
content:
In this day and age, all the beautifully tragic and emotional romantic situations from older movies and books are a lot more difficult to come by. Lost loves, missed opportunities, lovers' quests...are all taking on new shapes and forms.. This new series of shorts might give you an idea of what we mean.

title: Somewhere Like This
content:
We're making a movie! Help make it happen here: http://wongfuproductions.com/movie

Across clear skies. Among glowing stars. That's where I'll find us.

BEHIND THE SCENES: http://youtu.be/aUiBQCUOD7o
COMMENTARY: http://wongfuproductions.com/2013/04/somewhere-like-this-directors-notes/

Have you ever found yourself revisiting a chapter of your life when you least expected to? Does the story continue where it last left off? Or does it start over with new characters and conflicts? "Somewhere Like This" explores the effects of distance and time on a young couple, Scott and Irene.

title: Together At Last - Engagement Video - Wong Fu Productions
content:
This is a video we made for our friends Eddie and Sarah who recently got married this summer! They have a great story.
Eddie lived in LA, Sarah lived in Taipei. For 5 years they had to deal with this distance in their relationship, always having to fly back and forth. Finally, the two are Together At Last.

The song used is "Say it Again" by Marie Digby. Check out her music, she's really talented!
All rights reserved to her and her label. We aren't affiliated with her, but wish we were, haha.
The two in the video ARE actually Eddie and Sarah. They did a great job acting!

title: Funemployed - Ep 9 - Lonely, lonely Kyle
content:
"Funemployed" a new web series by Wong Fu Productions and KevJumba
Now that Kyle and Jason "broke up", Kyle seeks refuge with his old college friends; overgrown, deadbeat frat bros.
Follow Jason and Kyle on their journey through unemployment as they discover what their friendship and chasing dreams really mean.

title: The One Days: HK - Dream Line
content:
Official Selection to LA Asian Pacific Film Fest 2009

A couple spend a carefree day together with the underlying knowledge that they may soon have to separate.  The two share bittersweet memories as they recall their time together in the busy city.  From the subway to the ferry, Hong Kong's public transportation carries their story and also acts as a metaphor for the future of their relationship.  Written as a prequel to "The Spare" (VC Film Fest 2008).  Shot in one day in Hong Kong.

Watch what happens next in "The Spare"

title: BEST OF LONDON - Music-ish Video
content:
We were in London a couple weeks ago to make short films.. not a song or a music video, but we did that anyway. Here is our masterpiece.

We like seeing and experiencing the non touristy, local, things when we travel. You can get more local than traffic lights and doors.

Extraordinary beat produced by: AJ http://youtube.com/ilajil
Hot fire rap/singing? by: Wong Fu Productions http://youtube.com/wongfuproductions
Featuring:
AJ Rafael http://youtube.com/ilajil
Mike Relm http://youtube.com/relmvision
Jason Horton http://youtube.com/jasonhorton
Rex Pearson http://youtube.com/rexpearson1

Watch MORE from our London trip:
Vlog 2: http://youtu.be/1s29vThNC1Q
Vlog 2: http://youtu.be/A2BQdUxEYhs


BEST LYRICS EVAR:
We're finally here in London town
Hearing the sights, and seeing the sounds
Everyone goes to see the same old things
But here's what we find interesting.

A gate to a place we couldn't go into
A bike is what we really want to show you
This rubber band made wes' day
Oh no this garbage truck is getting away

Real London isn't about the tourist spots
It's about 
Traffic lights
Pipes
and this Bus stop

No one wants to see that big ol wheel
This beautiful light pole the real deal

Look it's door - A British door
The number 7 -  Wow that's so interesting
Trash cans - post that on your instagram
Egg cartons - why is he touching it like that?

On "the tube" they have these awesome poles
This walk way signal tells Phil to hold.

A leaf, a lock, a plant
That bird is such a hater
Look how much fun we're having on this escalator!

Thanks YouTube Music Awards for sending us to London to get inspired.

title: A Peace of Home
content:
Official Selection to 2008 Cannes International Short Film Corner
A musical short for anyone who has ever missed home, or the feeling of what home is.

After moving from her home in the city to the suburbs, a young girl finds a way to feel less homesick.

Shot in San Francisco's Chinatown and Philip's hometown of Walnut Creek.

title: Orient Express - Wong Fu Productions x Interpretations Film
content:
This is Wong Fu Productions' submission to the Interpretations Film Initiative.[We are Not part of the contest] WFP, along with many other notable directors, were commissioned to create a short based on four lines of provided dialogue. It is a great honor to be showcasing our work with such amazing talent. Interpretations is a contest headed by Justin Lin (Better Luck Tomorrow, Fast and Furious). Any aspiring filmmakers should definitely use this opportunity to stretch their creative muscles! ( http://interpretationsfilm.com )

Shot in one day in Norman, Oklahoma, during our 2010 Spring Tour, at a location we found the day before, and with friends we met the day before.

Commentary here:
http://wongfuproductions.com/2010/06/orient-express-wong-fu-x-interpretations-film/

title: Wong Fu's Making a Movie!
content:
We're making a movie & we need YOUR help to make it happen!
Visit http://wongfuproductions.com/movie to show your support!

After years of making videos here on YouTube for our awesome fanbase of supporters, after making so many short films that we are so proud of... it's finally time. It's time to make a movie.
We're so nervous to be reaching out to our fans in this way, we've never asked for direct monetary contributions, but a project on this scale really needs your help. 
If you've ever enjoyed our work, if anything we've made has affected you in some way, please consider donating to the project and you'll get some awesome rewards, as well as feeling great to know you are helping WFP take the next step in this incredible journey we're all on together.
Please share this link, spread the word. Wong Fu's first movie is on the way!

Thank you for your years of support and encouragement. Thank you for believing in us. We've only just begun!
-Wes, Ted, Phil, & the whole Wong Fu team!

title: Away We Happened - Ep 6 - Finale
content:
THANK YOU for making Away We Happened such a huge success for us. It was such a challenge to go out and make each new episode every week, but we can't believe we made it through the 6 weeks. We're glad to see such an amazing response to the series, wanting longer and more episodes, so you can be sure that this won't be the last time you see a drama series from Wong Fu Productions. Until then, we've got LOTS of new and exciting projects coming your way, so subscribe, follow, like below and join us for the ride!

Behind the Scenes: http://wongfuproductions.com/2012/06/away-we-happened-finale/

title: JC Penney presents International Secret Agents (ISA) Concerts 2010: New York, Los Angeles
content:
Concert and ticket info at
http://InternationalSecretAgents.com

In 2008 we started a concert series with Far East Movement called the International Secret Agents. In 2 years we've put on 3 sold out shows in California to thousands of fans and supporters, bringing together some of the greatest talents in our community to preform, unite, and inspire. This year for the first time, we're taking ISA out of CA and to the East. Two Coasts, Two Concerts.
Partnering with JCPenney, MTV Iggy, and 4C the Power, we're proud to continue the growth of ISA!

title: WFW 90 - Our Dancing, Gaming, Arts&Craft Shows!
content:
Did you know we've had our own special shows on ISAtv this whole past year? Here are some highlights! Check out the links below to watch more from each series!

Wes' "The MakeShift"
http://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLEFFCA32844C644C0

Phil's "Step by Step"
http://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLFD18FCD5382E0C0C 

Ted's "Rage Quit with Ted"
http://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL0447D7B471410299

And check out all the other great shows in ISAtv http://www.youtube.com/ISATV

Why "ISA"? Where did ISA come from? We've had a long history with ISA. http://isatv.com/about/
INTERNATIONAL - Being Asian American, we're often conflicted because, here in America, we're stereotypically viewed as ethnic, never just American. But when we go visit "the mother land" everyone there doesn't think we're really Asian, we're American. We want to bridge this gap!
SECRET - We feel that everyone has a secret identity, whether it's because people assume things about you judging by your appearance/background/ethnicity, or because we don't get the opportunity to ever show the other side to us. Among Asian Americans, we're just now beginning to shed certain stereotypes and want people to know that we have another identity that may have been a "secret" before.
AGENTS - We're all working together, on a mission, to build our community, work with other communities, and just bring positivity to our industry and the lives we come in contact with.

**Sorry no Holiday Special this year. We were all traveling and didn't have time to shoot one together! We'll make it up!**

title: The One Days: HK - See Through
content:
Official Selection to LA Asian Pacific Film Fest 2009

Sometimes the most personal advice can be found in complete strangers. Listening to the experiences of another can help us apply what they've learned into our own lives. Two travelers on different ends of a similar situation find peace and understanding through each others words and presence. 
Shot in one day in Hong Kong with the friends we were traveling with.

title: THE SPARE - Wong Fu Productions
content:
The Spare is a short narrative that evolved from the idea of a simple phone conversation.  Essentially, it is a brief glimpse of two people's lives as we see them in everyday life.  The Spare reveals a playful, endearing, and realistic relationship between a young couple as they have a casual conversation.  Produced as a part of a collective series called The One Days: HK, this short shows real people in familiar and commonplace Hong Kong surroundings.  Shot in one day in Tseung Kwan O.

Written/Directed by Wesley Chan
Featuring Helen Ma and Kinson Tam
Music by Philip Wang

title: "Home is Where the Hans Are" - Trailer
content:
Derek has been away from home for 2 years, distancing himself from his mother and life back home. But in the end, his dreams have gotten him nowhere and he reluctantly decides to return home. To his surprise though, his new step-dad and family are not what he expected, and this new life might just be what he needs most.

*Our goal with this series is to show a general audience who might not be used to seeing Asians as a typical TV family, that seeing our faces in these roles should not be strange. We have a place among everyone else and we can all get along and make great content. We're excited to be working with FremantleMedia who sees the potential for Asian Americans in the mainstream media. We hope you can share and support this new project.

More details: http://wongfuproductions.com/2012/01/trailer-home-is-where-the-hans-are/

Produced/Written/Directed by: Wong Fu Productions

title: 10 Year Anniversary (WFW 99)
content:
The first official "Wong Fu Productions" video was released on June 8, 2003. Today marks the 10th year that Wong Fu has been creating videos.
It's been an incredible journey. A decade of work that has reached and influenced so many people around the world. But none of it could've happened without you. You've changed our lives by simply watching, telling a friend, buying merchandise, coming to a show. We are forever grateful, and we hope that we've been able to make you proud and give back a fraction of what you've given to us the past 10 years. From the deepest part of our hearts...Thank you.

For an indepth look at Wong Fu's "college years" watch this: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7QqIYanYtWM

title: Take It Slow
content:
It seems as though slow dancing is fading away as slow love songs are becoming less popular.  We hope that despite the radios and DJs not playing them, that people will still find a way to have this special moment together, because there are few things like the innocent romantic emotions that come from slowly swaying with a person you really care about, to a good, sweet song. As we grow up, slow dancing is one of those things that don't happen much anymore.  So don't take it for granted... slow dance whenever and wherever, because there are fewer and fewer opportunities to (if at all) as time goes on.

BEHIND THE SCENES & FULL DIRECTOR'S COMMENTARY: http://wongfuproductions.com/2012/04/take-it-slow-new-short/

title: Summer RAP - Video Blog 12
content:
WE WANNA GET TO KNOW YA!

1) A lot of people have asked us if we were ever going to make a PO BOX for people to send us...stuff?  Well, we finally did, so if you wanna mail us things (no rotten tomatoes or dead animals please) send it to

Wong Fu Productions
PO BOX 7868
Alhambra, CA 91802

If we get something unique, extremely sweet, or super cool we might even feature it on a future blog!

2) Help us by taking our POLL! We've got some GREAT fans, but we wish we knew more about you all. So we started this poll on our main website and every so often we'll update it with new questions, sometimes they'll be totally wacky, sometimes we'll actually need your help to decide something! So stop by our main website for 10sec and SCROLL DOWN to the bottom to enter your vote.
http://www.wongfuproductions.com

3) SPECIAL PUBLIC EVENT! You're invited! If you live in the LA area, we'd love you to come by our release party on July 29th at 6pm at the Nucleus Gallery in Alhambra.  For all the details go here...
http://www.gallerynucleus.com/event/163

Check our main website for more information on all the events, news, and videos!

PS, we love Lil Wayne. Sorry for ruining his song. haha

title: AT MUSING'S END - Part 1 of 2
content:
AT MUSING'S END - Part 2 of 2:
http://youtube.com/watch?v=SDOz65cst24&fmt=18 

Everyone daydreams.  But what's in a daydream?  It's a little bit of care-free imagination mixed with real life experiences- and topped off with a pinch of idealism.  Sometimes the most interesting and meaningful moments we have are the everyday happenings that are easily forgettable.  In the end, these moments are the true treasures that we cherish.  In this short narrative, we see the evolution of Robin and Adams' romance through the highs and lows of their relationship.  

Official Selection of the 2008 Cannes Film Festival Short Films Corner

Written and Directed by Wesley Chan
Produced with Philip Wang and Ted Fu
Featuring Mimi Chao, William Yu, and Po Fung
Music by Jesse Chui, Henry Tsai, and Moby

For more shorts and original work visit:
http://www.wongfuproductions.com

For original music by Jesse Chui visit:
http://www.songsforcinema.com

title: "The Sleep Shift" - Concept Trailer - Wong Fu Productions
content:
"The Sleep Shift"
A concept trailer created by Wong Fu Productions along with Matrix Capital Entertainment.

This trailer was shot as a showcase of an idea for a prospective new feature from Wong Fu Productions. The actual movie has not been made yet, this is just a teaser.  The real movie is still some time away.  Until then, this is our vision.

Simon is forced into a listless and troubled life when he must take on the responsibility to work the nightshift at his family-owned convenient store. Working the graveyard hours causes him to sleep during the day. 
After realizing his anxiety has led him to sleepwalk regularly, he begins to record his unconscious experiences.
To his amazement, Simon discovers that his life asleep is more exciting and desirable than his life awake.

Exec Producer:
Eric Wang

Produced/Written/Directed/Cinematography by:
Wesley Chan
Ted Fu
Philip Wang

Edited by: Wesley Chan

Art Director: Xiao Qiao Liu

Simon: Daniel Franco

title: The One Days: HK - Lost to Luck
content:
Feeling lost and unaccomplished, a young man spends a day to catch up with his younger sister. In their odd quest to find a "reincarnated" pet goldfish, the brother comes to see that he is not as alone and unlucky as he once thought. Sometimes, help can come in the most peculiar and unexpected forms. Shot in one day in Mong Kok and Central in Hong Kong.

Written and Directed by Wesley Chan
Produced with Philip Wang
Featuring Perry Sham and Helen Ma

title: Yellow Fever (2006) - Re-Release Official
content:
This is the OFFICIAL version of our most popular short film. We didn't really start using this channel until 2008, and just recently decided that we should put up our most popular short film since there's so many other versions out there. Perfect timing though, exactly 4 years since its original release in 2006, we're finally releasing Yellow Fever on our official YouTube channel.

Music: We had to change the original music because we didn't own it. Sorry if you liked the old one better.

title: Strangers, again - Trailer
content:
Watch the full short, now released HERE: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tSdELZxEnHY

The most unfortunate fact about a relationship that doesn't work out, is the inevitable path both parties are on to become strangers. Many relationships follow a general path, through a set of different stages, one that brings two strangers together, takes them through a period of deep emotions and meaningful experiences, then returns them to where they began.

In this upcoming new short, WFP takes a journey through a "typical" relationship's stages.

Written and Directed by Philip Wang
Produced with Wesley Chan and Ted Fu
Assistant Producer: Christine Chen
Production Assistant: Regina Fang

Featuring:
Cathy Nguyen http://youtube.com/lilcdawg
Philip Wang
David Choi http://youtube.com/davidchoimusic

title: AT MUSING'S END - Part 2 of 2
content:
AT MUSING'S END - Part 1 of 2:
http://youtube.com/watch?v=tgx8wpr6-eY&fmt=18 

Everyone daydreams.  But what's in a daydream?  It's a little bit of care-free imagination mixed with real life experiences- and topped off with a pinch of idealism.  Sometimes the most interesting and meaningful moments we have are the everyday happenings that are easily forgettable.  In the end, these moments are the true treasures that we cherish.  In this short narrative, we see the evolution of Robin and Adams' romance through the highs and lows of their relationship.  

Official Selection of the 2008 Cannes Film Festival Short Films Corner

Written and Directed by Wesley Chan
Produced with Philip Wang and Ted Fu
Featuring Mimi Chao, William Yu, and Po Fung
Music by Jesse Chui, Henry Tsai, and Moby

For more shorts and original work visit:
http://www.wongfuproductions.com

For original music by Jesse Chui visit:
http://www.songsforcinema.com

title: The Turn Off
content:
Bites his nails? That's fine.
Socks don't match? Ahh, who cares?
Bad breath? Just give him some gum.
So what's the ultimate turn off??

The American Cancer Society asked Wong Fu Productions to help out with their an anti smoking campaign "X Out Cig". And since we here at Wong Fu are down with this whole- no smoking thang, we were on board help them and make this quick, fun short.

title: Seldom
content:
A personal project by Philip. 
I don't say "thank you" to my family as often as I should or could for all they've done for me in my lifetime, but I'm trying to change.

During Thanksgiving last year (2008) while visiting home, I took out my camcorder and shot this little piece in one evening with my dad. The thxgiving meal is with my mom, sister, grandma, and cousin.
I held onto the footage over the past year and finally edited it recently. Thought it'd be cool to share it with the holiday coming up. Hope you enjoy this simple (staged) moment and can find the same moments in your life.

Music by David Choi
http://youtube.com/davidchoimusic
http://davidchoimusic.com

Special thanks to "jeh" my sister.

title: PEOPLE PLACES AND THINGS (Part 3 of 4)
content: a new four part short, told backwards, based on one of our most common everyday practices-- the conversation. Follow Cliff as he talks with his unique friends: Alvin, Ashley, Clark, and Max. title: TWO TRUE - Wong Fu Productions
content:
Two conversations that show the unpredictable nature and outcomes of our crushes.  Both shorts were written in one night and shot back to back within one evening in Tseung Kwan O and Times Square of Hong Kong.

After transferring to international school in Hong Kong, Daphne talks to her best friend about the upcoming dance.

Before going to work, Kinson retells his encounter with the girl of his dreams to his visiting brother.

For more of the One Days HK series visit: http://www.youtube.com/user/thewesleychan

title: Somewhere Like This - Trailer
content:
WATCH THE FULL SHORT HERE: http://youtu.be/83BxayyVcbA

Have you ever found yourself revisiting a chapter of your life when you least expected to? Does the story continue where it last left off? Or does it start over with new characters and conflicts? "Somewhere Like This" explores the effects of distance and time on a young couple, Scott and Irene.

More preview here: http://wongfuproductions.com/2013/03/new-video-somewhere-like-this-teaser/

title: Behind the Scenes - When it Counts - Part 2
content:
Normally we just make videos on our own, with our friends. And sometimes we get opportunities to work on a bigger scale! Last December we teamed up with AT&T to create a web series called "When it Counts". title: PEOPLE PLACES AND THINGS (Part 1 of 4)
content:
A four part short, told backwards, based on one of our most common everyday practices-- the conversation. Follow Cliff as he talks with his unique friends: Alvin, Ashley, Clark, and Max. From their conversations you'll find out how they're connected, where they've been, and what they'll do.

Inspired by a couple of Wes' fav directors and movies. Wes Anderson...and homage to Ocean's 11

For more of this short visit
http://www.wongfuproductions.com/PPAT/

For more videos visit
http://www.wongfuproductions.com

title: THANK YOU from Wong Fu 2010
content:
To the past, present, and future...
We wanted to start the year off right, and that meant, to try and reach out to everyone who has ever watched us to say THANK YOU for supporting. And that includes YOU!
Whether you saw only one video way back, or you keep up with each of our new videos...you've been a part of our lives and helped us continue this thing called "Wong Fu Productions"

Please share and pass this on to any of your friends who have ever watched or enjoyed any of our work so that we can say thank you to them too.

COMING in 2010
-Many more short films, music videos, and video blogs
-Spring and Autumn Tours
-More ISA concerts
-New toys, tees, and cool stuff in our store
-A new WEEKLY online show "Wong Fu Weekends"
-Begin working on our next full length feature

Music by David Choi
http://youtube.com/davidchoimusic

OFFICIAL
http://wongfuproductions.com

STORE
http://areyouaniceguy.com

FACEBOOK
http://facebook.com/wongfuproductions

TWITTER
http://twitter.com/wongfupro

Thanks for the support past, present and FUTURE! 2010 is going to be a big year, lots of new shorts, music videos and vlogs coming soon!

title: Just A Nice Guy - Trailer - Wong Fu Productions
content:

Nick is the nice guy we all know. He's polite, considerate, friendly...and single. In this 3 part mini series, Nick explains his frustration with being the nice guy, and tries to figure out if there's anyway to get the girl he likes, Amy, to see him as anything other than, "a nice guy"

title: Wong Fu Productions - Video Blog 14 - Major Concert Event and Project Michelle
content:
http://www.internationalsecretagents.com
Visit to purchase tickets and get more information about the event!
We really need your support, hope to see you there!
Email: isashowcase@gmail.com if you want to help sell tickets or promote!

http://www.projectmichelle.com
Imagine if your best friend, sister, wife, daughter was diagnosed with cancer, and the only way to save them was through a transplant, but you weren't a match.  This is the case for Michelle and her friends and family.  She needs a bone marrow transplant, but sadly, no match has been found yet, and there is an incredibly low number of donors who are registered.  Please take a moment as you're sitting at your computer to visit the website, educate yourself, and hopefully reach out to register. You might be the one that is a match, and could save her life. Please help.
http://www.projectmichelle.com

For more from Wong Fu Productions visit:
http://www.wongfuproductions.com
http://www.youtube.com/wongfuproductions

http://www.fareastmovement.com

*video made with no crew and no budget*

LYRICS
-Written by Sam Geunjin Kang

Red light on a four-way street
We stop at the center where the people make the heart beat
Cigarette smoke blown to the night
As the girl plays Cello got those moon shaped eyes
Time flies real slow cause she's playing a tune
So rich you couldn't fall through. All the boys kick
Back and lax with the cigarette latched on their mouth
Take it in with a heave from the lungs breathe out
Real thugs we were warned as danger
Never make eyes with the hard eyed stranger
Less you can get that born respect
All bow to the old but ageless
Walks through the concrete easy with the mind to leave
A city at the brink of its peak
Cold breeze sweeps in put the windows up
Green light now its time too move on
So move it on up
 
Up and we'll go where you want to
Cause I never thought that we'd make it this far
So let's go up cause we'll go where you want to
Cause I never thought that we'd make it this far
 
So move it on up past neon expos lit
Packed late in small shops for old school dishes
Mrs. in the back making late night snacks
For kids with rich kicks who came with cash
And a flash from the cam makes the room dim
as the k town girl comes in. cute face
all dressed to impress whoever has the money to risk
Now sits to the front with some friends
Scent mixed light with the air that breaks through
Perfume bites through the air for victims
Sneaks to the back but gets caught with a backlash
Some kid's smell over sprayed with name brands
Hard wind blows so it leaves the shop
Moves above engine smoke to the dark
All the stars gaze past genesis and mars
soft wind blows so forever it goes on and on and up
 
Bus at the stop all full
Drives through the city from a day well used
Kids at the back seat, mother at side
Time moves as the tired make it out of the night
Sweet flood of emotion making it's way
In a place where the hard work pays
Face of an immigrant soul who got cast to cold
Where the soul got warm from the hands that bore us
Old eyes looking back all eyes looking at
the fact of the matter that the young is strong
Dreams come rushing through fresh minds coming to
find that tomorrow we can both shine on
Night comes looking for dim light coming on
sunshine breaking up the thieves and mice
streets stay empty as the dark gets blended
With the taste of the good life
So we gotta go fly
 
Fly high through broken skies
And say that you'll try not to be late
There's no need to wait
Fly high through broken skies
And say that youll try not to be late
Theres no need to wait
Were pushing away

title: Our Fanz is Da besT - Video Blog 13
content:
We just had an event on July 29th, and about 300+ fans came by to wait in the heat, for 2 hrs in a line, just to say hi to us and take pictures.  It means a lot to us and we're so grateful for your support!
The least we can do is feature a few of the especially extra nice things people did for us, like writing letters/cards, bringing food, and giving gifts.

Watch our NEWEST music video.

http://www.wongfuproductions.com

NEW Tshirts! The shirts we're wearing are coming to our online store VERY soon!  More news to come when they're released!

title: International Secret Agents: Los Angeles 2009
content:
TICKETS SOLD OUT!!!

Watch past concert clips at
http://youtube.com/isaconcert

JCPenney presents ISA LA 2009!

ISA returns to where it all began one year ago! On Sept. 6, 2009 (Labor Day weekend) Wong Fu Productions and Far*East Movement are bringing together some of the best and brightest talent among Asian Americans breaking into the mainstream media. With a goal to inspire a new generation and showcase real AA talent that doesn't get the attention it truly deserves!

ISA LA 2008 and ISA San Francisco 2009 were all sold out shows to over 1000 fans and supporters. Don't miss your chance to experience a concert like none other.

title: SHELL - Trailer
content:
Trailer for new short: "Shell" Coming August 31, 2011

Our lives are shaped by our experiences. Our experiences are preserved in our memories. But what if we had a chance to remember things that we never actually experienced? "Shell" explores this idea through a quiet conversation. If you could look through a window that softened the edge between reality and fiction, what would you want to see? What would you want to remember?

More Details on WFP Blog: http://wongfuproductions.com/2011/08/new-shell-short-coming-soon/

Written and Directed by Wesley Chan
Produced with Philip Wang

Featuring:
Chris Dinh
Mimi Chao

title: WONG FU MOVIE Live Stream #1 (Previously Recorded)
content:
SUPPORT HERE: http://www.indiegogo.com/projects/wong-fu-productions-first-feature-film

We're making a movie & we need YOUR help to make it happen!
Visit http://wongfuproductions.com/movie to show your support!

After years of making videos here on YouTube for our awesome fanbase of supporters, after making so many short films that we are so proud of... it's finally time. It's time to make a movie.
We're so nervous to be reaching out to our fans in this way, we've never asked for direct monetary contributions, but a project on this scale really needs your help. 
If you've ever enjoyed our work, if anything we've made has affected you in some way, please consider donating to the project and you'll get some awesome rewards, as well as feeling great to know you are helping WFP take the next step in this incredible journey we're all on together.
Please share this link, spread the word. Wong Fu's first movie is on the way!

Thank you for your years of support and encouragement. Thank you for believing in us. We've only just begun!
-Wes, Ted, Phil, & the whole Wong Fu team!

title: POSER! Teaser Trailer
content:
Where did the "Peace sign" come from? How did it spread around the world, and how did each culture develop their own way of showing it? Where do new poses come from? "POSER!" will introduce us to a research organization that will answer all these questions.
POSER! - The history and evolution of the "Peace Sign"

A new mockumentary from Wong Fu Productions
Written and Directed by Philip Wang

title: Wong Fu at Niagara Falls tomorrow!!
content:
We're on tour, but because we're in Buffalo, NY and soooo close to the Canadian border, we wanted to show our Canadian fans some love.
We can't drive all the way up to Toronto, but we have time to head to Niagara Falls and cross the border. So if you have time to drive out we're going to be at....

The Great Canadian Midway on Clifton Hill
6p-8p
Tomorrow, Wednesday Oct 21

Let's have an epic "international" meet & greet!!!

This video will self destruct tomorrow.

Follow us at
http://twitter.com/wongfupro 
to get up to the minute details.
